text.en: Are you overly sensitive to light or brightness?
Are you overly sensitive to touch?
Are you easily or overly scared?
Do you tend to have phobias?
Do you have separation anxiety?
Are you easily startled, even by small noises or sudden movements?
Do you often have tightness in the neck or frequent headaches?
Are you holding the pen in a tense grip while writing?
Do you press down on the paper too hard when writing?
Is your handwriting often illegible or difficult to read?
Do you have little desire to write, or do you tire quickly while doing so?
Do you often like to rest your head while sitting?
Do you often need to stretch while sitting, or do you find it difficult to sit still?
Do you suffer from motion sickness, such as feeling dizzy in cars or on boats?
Do you have a poor sense of direction, getting lost easily?
Do you have difficulty finding your way around new buildings or places?
Do you have difficulties with spelling?
Do you have difficulties with grammar?
Do you have difficulty with math?
Are you easily irritated or quick to anger?
Do you mind tight clothing or feel easily bothered by constrictive outfits?
Do you wrap your legs around the chair legs while sitting?
Do you often sit on your legs or tuck them underneath you?
Do you have trouble catching a ball or timing your catch properly?
Are you clumsy, bumping into objects or people more than others do?
Do you have trouble learning to swim, especially with breaststroke?
Do others say that you often look suspicious or wary, even when you’re not?
Do people sometimes say you come across as snobbish or distant?
Do you love routines and prefer not to deviate from them?
Do you have trouble with changes in plans or spontaneity?
Do you suffer from asthma or allergies?
Do you often have a cold or the flu?
Did you have braces to correct your teeth alignment?
Do you have excessive salivation or drooling?
Did you suck your thumbs for a long time as a child?
Do you have bow legs (O-legs) or knock knees (X-legs)?
Do you try to avoid conflicts whenever possible?
Do you often freeze or feel unable to act in scary situations?
Do you have trouble putting your thoughts into writing?
Do you have trouble expressing your feelings in words?
Do you often have trouble maintaining your balance when walking or standing?
Do you have a poor sense of time, often running late or feeling stressed by schedules?
Do you have trouble remembering things, even short lists or tasks?
Do you have digestive problems that worsen when you’re anxious or tense?
Do you have scoliosis or a noticeable curvature in your spine?
Do you dislike leaning against the backrest of a chair, preferring to sit forward?
Do you often have back pain, especially in the lower back region?
Did you skip crawling as a baby, going straight to walking?
Do you find it difficult to make decisions, feeling paralyzed by choices?
Do you have problems with distance or near vision, making reading or driving challenging?
Do you have low self-confidence or feel anxious in social settings?
Do you have problems with speaking or articulation, such as slurring or mispronouncing words?
Do you have problems with gross motor skills, like running, jumping, or coordinating larger movements?
Do you have problems with fine motor skills, like handling small objects or fastening buttons?
Does your big toe regularly tear through your socks or shoes from curling or pressure?
Are you stiff or inflexible in your movements, feeling limited in your range of motion?
Did you have a difficult puberty, experiencing intense emotional swings or physical tension?
Do you find it difficult to roll on the floor sideways, feeling uncoordinated or dizzy?
Do you sometimes feel your body reacts with ’babyish’ reflexes in adulthood? For example, curling your toes or clenching your fists involuntarily when startled?
Have you ever noticed that in highly stressful moments, you revert to childhood coping habits (e.g., sucking on your thumb or biting objects)?
